etymologies: mid 17th century: from Spanish vainilla ‘pod’, diminutive of vaina ‘sheath, pod’, from Latin vagina ‘sheath’. The spelling change was due to association with French vanille

definitions: a substance obtained from vanilla beans or produced artificially and used to flavor sweet foods or to impart a fragrant scent to cosmetic preparations
shortDefinitions: substance obtained from vanilla pods or produced artificially and used to flavour foods or to impart fragrant scent

examples.text: four scoops of vanilla with hot fudge sauce

definitions: of the yellowish-white color of vanilla ice cream
shortDefinitions: of creamy colour of vanilla ice cream

definitions: a tropical climbing orchid that has fragrant flowers and long podlike fruit.

notes.text: Genus Vanilla, family Orchidaceae: many species, in particular V. planifolia, the chief commercial source of vanilla beans

definitions: the fruit of the vanilla plant which is cured and then either used in cooking or processed to extract an essence which is used for flavor and fragrance.
shortDefinitions: fruit of vanilla plant which is cured and then either used in cooking or processed to extract essence which is used for flavour and fragrance

definitions: having no special or extra features; ordinary or standard

examples.text: choosing plain vanilla technology wherever you can will save you money
the original, vanilla MP3 format is still the most commonly encountered form of the technology
they seem to be quite content in their plain vanilla domestic life

shortDefinitions: having no special or extra features
